awd_titl_txt: Conference Proposal: 2023 CREST Program / Understanding Interventions Conference
awd_abstract_narration:
With support from the Centers of Research Excellence in Science and Technology (CREST), this project aims to provide a convening of researchers and practitioners from CREST programs and the Understanding Interventions communities of scholarship and practice. This project will provide venues for professional development (workshops), dissemination (symposia, poster sessions) of interventions research, as well as discourse (deeper dives), and training (workshops) for members across communities of practice and research. In addition, this project will facilitate networking to foster opportunities for collaborations between the various research and practice stakeholders. This work is important to informing the approaches, strategies and activities of programs aimed at broadening participation in science careers. 

This two-day conference will facilitate training, networking and dissemination of work related to the funded CREST program sites and interventions related research.  Expected results include increase networks between CREST and UI communities leveraging the newly developed STEM social media platform, UI IMPACTS (Inclusive Matching for Professional Advancement and Career Training in Science).  We also expected community building and communication between participants and the general science community beyond the UI/CREST Conference.  The CREST/UI joint conference proceedings and presentations will be disseminated via the UI Journal, UI INDEX, and the UI Portal.  All abstracts from posters, symposia and deeper dives will be published in a conference issue of the UI Journal.  All presentations will be available on the UI Portal.  The Centers of Research Excellence in Science and Technology (CREST) program provides support to enhance the research capabilities of minority-serving institutions through the establishment of centers that effectively integrate education and research.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

por.por_cntn:
Outcomes Report: Understanding Interventions/NSF CREST 2023 Annual Conference

 

The "Understanding Interventions/NSF CREST 2023 Annual Conference" titled "Connecting Communities and Leveraging Resources to Maximize Impact" was held on August 25-26, 2023, at the Marriott Salt Lake City Center, Utah. This initiative was supported by NSF Award #23346553, administered by Jackson State University. The conference aimed to explore strategies for fostering inclusion and equity in STEM fields through collaborative partnerships and resource sharing.

The event hosted over 250 attendees, including academic researchers, educators, and representatives from community organizations. It featured 25 sessions, including keynote speeches, symposia, panel discussions, and poster sessions, showcasing research and STEM interventions. A significant component of the conference was its focus on professional development, with tracks dedicated to skill-building and career advancement. Notably, there was a postdoctoral track with a full day of workshops specifically targeted professional development for postdoctoral scholars, providing tools and resources to support their career trajectories.

Project Outcomes The project achieved several significant outcomes based on the conference proceedings and attendee evaluations:

Intellectual Merit

  1. Development of Interventions: Presentations focused on approaches to enhance diversity and participation in STEM fields, particularly among underrepresented groups. These discussions emphasized practical strategies to address barriers to inclusion.
  2. Collaborative Knowledge Exchange: Sessions enabled participants to share insights and data-driven approaches to improve STEM education and workforce pathways. Evaluations highlighted that 70% of attendees planned to implement at least one intervention that was discussed within their institutions.
  3. Dissemination of Research: The conference emphasized the dissemination of work and research related to broadening participation in science across a wide range of professional stages and disciplines. Attendees engaged with findings that spanned from early STEM education initiatives to advanced workforce interventions, ensuring the impact reached diverse stakeholders.

Broader Impacts

  1. Access to STEM Education: The conference highlighted efforts to expand educational opportunities and foster partnerships aimed at supporting underrepresented minorities in STEM fields. Survey feedback indicated that attendees valued discussions on establishing mentorship programs, with over 60% reporting increased confidence in implementing such initiatives.
  2. Community Engagement: Discussions included the importance of involving local communities in the development of interventions to ensure solutions align with their needs. Evaluation responses noted that 50% of attendees formed new collaborative networks aimed at community-centered STEM education projects.

 

Summary of the Award Outcomes: The NSF support facilitated a platform for dialogue and collaboration aimed at fostering inclusion in STEM. The conference provided actionable strategies for reducing inequities in STEM and disseminating best practices. Evaluations from attendees highlighted increased awareness of mentorship opportunities, a focus on culturally responsive practices, and plans for integrating new intervention strategies into existing programs.

Evaluation findings further underscored the conference’s impact, with 85% of respondents agreeing that the event deepened their understanding of effective STEM interventions and expanded their professional networks. Additionally, 40% reported initiating specific actions to enhance equity within their institutions within three months post-conference.

The professional development components were particularly impactful, with postdoctoral attendees reporting enhanced clarity about career pathways and improved confidence in navigating academic and industry opportunities. These outcomes align with NSF’s mission to promote inclusive science education and equitable opportunities, laying a foundation for future advancements in STEM equity.

 


Last Modified: 01/09/2025
Modified by: Joseph Whittaker
